did.abstract: These ledgers document South East Coal Company's annual accounts from January 1915 through December 1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These ledgers document South East Coal Company's annual accounts from January 1915 through December 1945. Included are South East's annual capital stock accounts, profit/ loss account balances, workers' salaries and insurance accounts, and loans and taxes accrued. Accounting for the expenses of the "SECO/ Millstone Store," "Houses and Buildings," "Operating," "School House," "Amusement Hall," "Stable and Livestock," "Powder and Explosives," and expenses for their mines (cars, rails, and motors) are also noted. The ledgers reveal that South East conducted business with companies located in various cities such as: Lexington, Kentucky; Cincinnati, Ohio; and Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The ledgers also note that South East conducted business with various notable companies including Standard Oil, Kentucky and West Virginia Power, Connecticut Electric Company, Elkhorn Coal Company, Coca-Cola Bottling, Dixie Ice Cream, Louisville News, Hazard Ice Cream, Aetna Life Insurance, and Cincinnati Electric.
